title.rendered: Delhi vs Bangalore, India Women’s League 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Laura Harris replaced Alice Capsey in the previous game but didn’t get a chance to bat.

Delhi: Meg Lanning (c), Shafali Verma, Laura Harris/Alice Capsey, Jemimah Rodrigues, Marizanne Kapp, Jess Jonassen, Taniya Bhatia (wk), Minnu Mani, Radha Yadav, Shikha Pandey, Tara Norris

Erin Burns played at the expense of Meghan Schutt in the previous game, but Megan might return to the team to add more firepower to their bowling.

Bangalore: Smriti Mandhana (c), Sophie Devine, Ellyse Perry, Kanika Ahuja, Heather Knight, Shreyanka Patil, Erin Burns/Meghan Schutt, Richa Ghosh (wk), Komal Zanzad, Renuka Thakur Singh, Sahana Pawar

Pitch Report

Venue: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, Navi Mumbai

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 140

2nd innings average score: 146

Wickets per innings: 5

Type: Balanced

Wins

Batting 1st: 33%

Batting 2nd: 67%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Heather Knight has been a delightful pick in fantasy leagues. She has generated a 30-run bonus thrice and picked four wickets in as many matches.

Marizanne Kapp’s recent form has been splendid. In her last 10 games, she has taken 15 wickets and scored 115 runs at 19.

Meg Lanning and Shafali Verma have scored 60% of Delhi’s runs at an average of 62.5. 

Ellyse Perry has registered two thirties and a fifty in the last four matches. However, she has gone wicketless in all four matches.

Sahana Pawar’s inclusion in the team was for a reason. She had taken the most wickets (5) for India A Women in Women’s T20 Trophy.

Richa Ghosh has featured in the Best11 in three of four matches in the tournament.

Four of Shikha Pandey’s five wickets in the tournament have come at this venue.

When the sides clashed earlier, Tara Norris (five wickets) was the captain of the Best11.

Bangalore have conceded over 200 runs in both matches they have bowled first, while Delhi have scored 200-plus runs in two of three games they have batted first.

Pacers have scalped two three-fors and a five-for while spinners have registered three three-fors in the last three matches at the venue, while only three fifties have been scored.
